topics.body:
"@HeroInferno":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c87676368726c020018a6#post_559c87676368726c020018a6
[bq="HeroInferno"]"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c862f63687211f20003fe#post_559c862f63687211f20003fe
I know its been at least 30 C during the daytime in this heat, normally I barely ever see it go past 23 C during summer. Right now its 15 C.

In lighter news, I have found a temporary solution to coping with the heat, until I have to go outside, I don't think common people will like my solution.[/bq]
We were 40 C here aound 12:00 pm.
If you can resist the heat, you can go outside. If not, stay in your house, drink water and turn on the fan/air conditioning.
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c87a86368724b5200121e#post_559c87a86368724b5200121e
Its the UK, its pretty humid here, sweatting doesn't really do much, and we're way more used to the cold over here. Theres health warnings all over the news with how bad this heat is. It's like being a polar bear in India, ain't natural.

Cause then you'd get all the neckbeards going "why isn't he instantly winning every time and just pressing one button instantly ends the match?  Totally unrealistic!" and constantly crying that he can't do a spirit bomb and saying that every time he gets nerfed that it's "unrealistic" and such.

If they ever put goku in smash this would happen "It's not fair that the other characters stand a chance against me and that I don't autowin!  Goku is the most powerful character!  He should win 100% of the time!  Worst game ever!"
